# addRenderContext(commandBuffer:)

**Instance Method**

Adds and returns a render context to a `LayerRenderer.Drawable` providing a metal command buffer.

## Declaration

```swift
func addRenderContext(commandBuffer cmd_buffer: any MTLCommandBuffer) -> LayerRenderer.Drawable.RenderContext
```

## Discussion

This object draws any content that the compositor needs to render in the app. The [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Drawable/RenderContext] can only be used when the layer renderer is using layered layout or on platforms that only render one view, such as the Simulator. The `RenderContext` makes use of the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Drawable/deviceAnchor] set in [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/cp_drawable_set_device_anchor]. Only use the `deviceAnchor` in the layer renderer drawable before calling [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Drawable/addRenderContext(commandBuffer:)].

## Adding a render context

- **LayerRenderer.Drawable.RenderContext**: An object the compositer uses for rendering all effects associated with a layer renderer drawable.
- **addRenderContext()**: Adds and returns a render context to a `LayerRenderer.Drawable` that draws any content required by the compositor.
